name: arxiv
description: arXiv API for academic paper search, pre-print discovery, and citation metadata retrieval

auth.note: arXiv API is freely accessible. Optional API key for higher rate limits.

tools.name: arxiv_search
tools.description: Search arXiv for academic papers by keyword, author, or category

parameters.search_query: Search query using arXiv query syntax (e.g., 'all:machine learning AND cat:cs.AI')
parameters.max_results: Maximum number of results to return (default: 10, max: 100)

tools.name: arxiv_get_paper
tools.description: Retrieve full metadata for a specific arXiv paper by ID

tools.name: arxiv_search_by_category
tools.description: Search papers within a specific arXiv category with date filtering

parameters.category: arXiv category (e.g., cs.AI, cs.CL, stat.ML, cs.MA, q-bio.BM)

tools.name: arxiv_get_references
tools.description: Retrieve the reference list for a specific paper for citation chain analysis

unauthenticated.note: 1 request per 3 seconds per arXiv terms of service

authenticated.note: Higher limits with registered API key

use_cases: Academic literature discovery for systematic reviews and meta-analyses
Pre-print search for cutting-edge research not yet peer-reviewed
Citation chain analysis: finding foundational and related works
Technology research: AI/ML papers, computer science, quantitative methods
Cross-disciplinary research spanning multiple arXiv categories
Author-based search to find all publications by key researchers
team_integration: The Source Analyst uses arXiv in academic and technology research modes to discover peer-reviewed and pre-print papers. Search typically involves keyword queries across relevant categories (cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.MA, stat.ML, etc.) followed by citation chain analysis using get_references. The Source Analyst evaluates each paper's methodology, sample size, and peer review status as part of credibility assessment. Results are documented with full metadata including DOI, authors, abstract, and submission date.
notes: arXiv MCP server is optional but strongly recommended for academic and technology research modes. The API is freely accessible without authentication. Rate limiting is handled automatically by the MCP server. For research involving healthcare, biology, or medical topics, supplement with PubMed (configured at platform level). The arXiv database contains over 2 million papers across physics, mathematics, computer science, biology, finance, and statistics.
